title: Iranian hard-liners unveil anti-US plaque at former embassy
content:
More than a dozen hard-line Iranian students have unveiled an anti-American plaque at the gate of the former U.S. Embassy in…  
 

 

 

✉ 

⎙ 

TEHRAN, Iran (AP) — More than a dozen hard-line Iranian students have unveiled an anti-American plaque at the gate of the former U.S. Embassy in Tehran. 

The plaque unveiled Wednesday by the Basij paramilitary forces carries a list of condemnations of America uttered by the Islamic republic's late founder, Grand Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini. During the gathering, the students set fire to U.S., British and Israeli flags. 

Iran and the U.S have had no diplomatic relations since 1979, when Iranian students stor…
